data.title: Best Wholesale Markets In Jaipur: Shop For Clothes, Jewelry, Grocery
data.meta_description: Best Wholesale Markets In Jaipur: Explore the wholesale markets in Jaipur, Johari Bazaar, Hawa Mahal Bazaar, etc for ethnic clothes, jewellery & groceries.
data.meta_site_name: OkCredit Blogs - Business Ideas, Tips, Government Schemes & more
data.text:
In Rajasthan's capital city, Jaipur, or Pink City, the markets and commerce sectors reflect the splendour of its cultures. A celebration and collection of woodcarvings, sandstone carvings, and marble carvings, including kundans and polkis crafted from semi-precious stones; pottery painted in blue; and colourful textiles can be found in the wholesale markets of Jaipur. The market centers offer visitors a wide variety of possibilities for bringing home stunning souvenirs, gifts, collectibles, and clothing.

Jaipur's markets are known for their high-quality fabrics and clothes. If you make it to one of these wholesale markets in Jaipur, you'll be amazed at their variety and quality. Customers can buy incredibly beautiful and stylish traditional couture, both for their boutiques and retail stores at wholesale prices.

To make your buying experience easier, we have provided you with an overview of the top wholesale markets in Jaipur.

Best Wholesale Markets In Jaipur

1. Johari Bazaar

Johari Bazaar is an old commercial center painted pink that has been deep-seated in history as one of the best and oldest wholesale markets in Jaipur. The word Johari means jeweler in Hindi. A great variety of jewellery made of gold, silver, and diamonds with intermittent emeralds, important to Rajasthani culture, is sold here. Not unexpectedly, the crowd, locals and visitors alike, are drawn to the shop for its exquisite jewellery.

Among the many shops available in the market are wholesale and distribution stores where you can find superb jewellery made from precious stones. There are many small souvenirs to choose from, including pendants, earrings, necklaces, neckpieces, and Polki bracelets. Explore this wholesale market in Jaipur for a gleaming experience.

You can also find here some spectacular Rajasthani wholesale sarees and lehengas to match your new ornaments and artifacts from the state's traditions. Along with the tie-and-dye fabrics Bandhani suits, this place lets you step up your style quotient with beautiful Mojaris and Jutis. You can get the best prices on the market at Johari Bazaar.

Location: 192, Johari Bazaar, Badi Choupad, Bapu Bazar, Ramganj Bazar, Jaipur, Rajasthan, 302002

Timing: 10 am – 11 pm

Closing Day: None

2. Hawa Mahal Bazaar

One of Jaipur's most famous landmarks is the Hawa Mahal, also known as the palace of winds. We recommend visiting the Hawa Mahal marketplace in the afternoon for a range of the highest quality jewellery, fabrics, and Rajasthani souvenirs at wholesale prices. When you visit the palace and market, you are sure to have a great time.

The Hawa Mahal Bazaar is known for its unique goatskin bags, offered in a variety of shapes and styles, ranging from handy slings to travel bags. Hand-carved blocks of wood are another special treat. The coveted Jaipuri Rajaiyan, quilts unique in their artisanry and functionality, are sold here as well.

Location: Hawa Mahal Rd, Badi Choupad, J.D.A. Market, Pink City, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302002

Hours of operation: 11 am – 8 pm

Closing day: Sunday (Some shops may be closed on Tuesday)

3. Wholesale Jaipur Kurti

There are many wholesale ethnic wear apparel markets, but this is the place to find designer Kurtis that feature exceptional designs, colours, and textures. As one of India's most popular ethnic fashions, the Jaipur Kurti has led to Jaipur becoming a global brand. Wholesale clothing destination for Kurtis in Jaipur, Bais Godam, offers a wide selection of clothing at a great price.

Jaipur Kurti has its design studio and production house and a team of expert designers, screen printers, dyers, stitchers and tie-dyers. Their workmanship and dedication are unrivalled. You will find a variety of Kurtis, Dupattas, Patiala Salwars and Salwar Kameez for girls and women of every age. Their unique superb quality makes them stand out. They are souvenirs of appeal, and Jaipur Kurti achieves this with style and elegance.

Location: Pearl Green Acres Apartments, A 301, 80 Feet Rd, Tejaji Nagar, Chhayadip Nagar, Shri Gopal Nagar, Gopal Pura Mode, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302018.

Timing: 10 am to 6.30 pm

Closing day: Sunday

Also read: Handicraft Manufacturer In Jaipur

4. Purohit Ji ka Katla

Jaipur has made its mark on the world map for deals and bulk shopping for weddings. Painted in pink, this market has been around for centuries. The most terrific market in the walled city, Purohit Ji ka Katla or sometimes referred to as Katla by locals, offers shoppers everything they need for their wedding ceremonies.

Location: Purohit Ji ka Katla, Johari Bazar Rd, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302002

From the Johari Bazaar, go towards Badi Chaupad, then ask passersby to guide you to the entrance.

Timing: 11 am to 9.30 pm

5. Shree Jagannath Gajak Bhandar

This local department store has been delighting customers for the last 20 years. Their success lies in the efficient service offered with a smile. You can count on the friendly workers in the store to help whenever you need. Those who shop at Shri Jagannath Gajak Bhandar in the Pink City benefit from a diverse selection of groceries in various categories sold at wholesale prices. The commitment to providing quality service is the store's core value.

Location: 12A, Gee Walo, Bordi Ka Rasta, Johari Bazar Road, Johri Bazar, Pink City, Jaipur

Timing: 9 am to 9.30 pm

Conclusion

The charm of traditional markets always wins the hearts of shopaholics. No matter how many superstores/malls appear and however convenient they get, there is a distinct satisfaction when strolling from shop to shop on a shopping spree. For generations, Jaipur has been proud of its scintillating bazaars. Known worldwide, you can find an assortment of handicrafts, colourful textiles, and ornaments here.

What place could be better than shopping from the best wholesale markets in Jaipur? Their traditional products are one-of-a-kind, of incredible quality, and priced reasonably. Grab your bags and fly to Jaipur for their wholesale markets, architectural wonders, and lip-smacking delicacies.

We hope you liked our article. To know more details about the best markets in India, you can visit these linked articles as well: Best markets in Bihar Best markets in Punjab Best markets in Odisha Best markets in Kerala Best markets in Gujrat Best markets in Haryana

FAQs

Q. What are some artisanal products unique to Jaipur?

Ans. The wholesale markets in Jaipur markets offer a variety of unique, artisanal products. Here are some items you might consider buying:

Lehariya saree

Blue pottery

Bedsheets with intricate embroidery

Handcrafted bags

Bandhej-printed cloth items

Items with Meenakari work

Q. What can I buy in Johari Bazar?

Ans. Johari Bazaar in Jaipur is known as the major wholesale market in Jaipur for its jewellery shops and is a popular place for those looking to purchase cloth, traditional stitched clothing, and other apparel.

Q. In Rajasthan, what should you buy?

Ans. While exploring the city, there are many wholesale markets in Jaipur where you can get your hands on:

Rugs

Accessories

Artwork

Gemstones and jewellery

Puppets, toys, and stuffed dolls

Q. On which day are the wholesale markets in Jaipur closed?

Ans. Each market in the city of Jaipur is closed on a different day of the week. Johari Bazaar is always open, but parts of the market remain closed on Sundays and Tuesdays. There are several major wholesale markets in Jaipur open throughout the week, including Bapu Bazar and Nehru Bazar.

Q. Jaipur is famous for its sweets, but which one is the best?

Ans. When visiting Jaipur, you should also indulge your sweet tooth. Specialities include phenni, ghevar, churma, moong dal halwa, gajjak, rabri, and gulaab sakri.
